scheduler

Class Parser

  • java.lang.Object
    • scheduler.Parser

  • public class Parser
extends java.lang.Object
    Parser provides general parsing functionality for other modules. This module will primarily be used in conjunction with the DataModule, which will handle loading data into the database and recalling data requested by the user.

      Parser()

      static java.lang.String[] parseRow(java.lang.String line, char delimeter, char esc)
      Parses a single row from a general file with a custom delimeter and escape character.
      static java.lang.String[] parseRow(java.lang.String line, char delimeter, char esc, char cls)
      Parses a single row from a general file with a custom delimeter, escape character, and clause character.

    • Method Detail

      • parseRow

        public static java.lang.String[] parseRow(java.lang.String line)
        Parses a single row from a general file. This parser does not perfectly adhere to RFC 4180 standards for CSV parsing. It cannot handle clauses separated across multiple lines in a file. This parse function separates on commas. A field wrapped in quotes may have commas inside without issue. As per RFC standards, a quote may be escaped by another quote. For example, "This "" String" would be parsed as 'This " String'.
        Parameters:
        line - a line of data to be parsed, separated by commas
        Returns:
        a String array of tokens parsed from the line

      • parseRow

        public static java.lang.String[] parseRow(java.lang.String line,
                                          char delimeter)
        Parses a single row from a general file with a custom delimeter. This parser does not perfectly adhere to RFC 4180 standards for CSV parsing. It cannot handle clauses separated across multiple lines in a file. This parse function separates on commas. A field wrapped in quotes may have commas inside without issue. As per RFC standards, a quote may be escaped by another quote. For example, "This "" String" would be parsed as 'This " String'.
        Parameters:
        line - a line of data to be parsed, separated by commas
        delimeter - used to separate tokens
        Returns:
        a String array of tokens parsed from the line

      • parseRow

        public static java.lang.String[] parseRow(java.lang.String line,
                                          char delimeter,
                                          char esc)
        Parses a single row from a general file with a custom delimeter and escape character. This parser does not perfectly adhere to RFC 4180 standards for CSV parsing. It cannot handle clauses separated across multiple lines in a file. This parse function separates on commas. A field wrapped in quotes may have commas inside without issue. As per RFC standards, a quote may be escaped by another quote. For example, "This "" String" would be parsed as 'This " String'.
        Parameters:
        line - a line of data to be parsed, separated by commas
        delimeter - used to separate tokens
        esc - used to prevent the following character from being treated as a clause character
        Returns:
        a String array of tokens parsed from the line

      • parseRow

        public static java.lang.String[] parseRow(java.lang.String line,
                                          char delimeter,
                                          char esc,
                                          char cls)
        Parses a single row from a general file with a custom delimeter, escape character, and clause character. This parser does not perfectly adhere to RFC 4180 standards for CSV parsing. It cannot handle clauses separated across multiple lines in a file. This parse function separates on commas. A field wrapped in quotes may have commas inside without issue. As per RFC standards, a quote may be escaped by another quote. For example, "This "" String" would be parsed as 'This " String'.
        Parameters:
        line - a line of data to be parsed, separated by commas
        delimeter - used to separate tokens
        esc - used to prevent the following character from being treated as a clause character
        cls - used to enclose a token that contains a delimeter character
        Returns:
        a String array of tokens parsed from the line
